Post_Title: The fact a lot of theists believe people deserve to burn in hell (potentially for eternity) proves that religion has a negative impact emotionally on otherwise decent people.
post_text:
I speak from experience as an agnostic exmuslim.

I asked my own devout muslim mother "You're my mother, you know me and my character. If I died today, the way I am, do you think I deserve to go to hell and burn forever?"

And she said yes. She said i deserve it for not obeying God. And that she wouldn't have any sympathy for me once I am in hell. 

My mother is a nice person. She's caring and loving and funny. But when it comes to religion, she turns into this evil callous monster that I dont recognise. 

Its not just my mother. Every Muslim or Christian or anyone who believes in a physical hell, directly or indirectly accepts people deserve to burn forever. 

People lose their humanity and put love for an invisible deity over love for a real physical human infront of them.

It saddens me and disappoints me that a good person would say something so horrendous just because a religion told them it was the right  



My argument is that religion does something to the human mind in the same way a drug does. It changes your perception on reality and that can be very dangerous. 

It "others" everybody that doesn't share your views and as a result you lose empathy for them and you accept the worst torture is justified upon them.
